abstract.text: The object for defining conditional properties for a component layout, and when the conditional properties are in effect.

inlineContent.text: An instance or array of conditions that, when met, cause the conditional component layout properties to take effect.
A number that indicates how many columns the component spans, based on the number of columns in the document. Note that for the
value to take effect, you need to specify
By default, the component spans the entire width of the document or the width of its container component.
A number that indicates which column the componentâ€™s start position is in, based on the number of columns in the document or parent container. Note that for the
value to take effect, you need to specify
By default, the component starts in the first column (note that the first column is
, not
The alignment of the content within the component. This property applies only when the width of the content is less than the width of the component.
The
, and
components support this property. All other components ignore this property.
A value that indicates whether Apple News ignores the gutters (if any) to the left and right of the component. The gutter size is defined in the
object at the root level of the document.

Use this option to position two components next to each other without a gutter between them. This property applies only when a gutter actually exists to the left or right of the component. The first column doesnâ€™t have a left gutter, and the last column doesnâ€™t have a right gutter.
Valid values:
(default). The component doesnâ€™t ignore the gutters.
. The component ignores the left gutter.
. The component ignores the right gutter.
. The component ignores gutters, if any, on both sides.
You can also set this property to
to indicate that you want to ignore
gutters, or set it to
to ignore none of the gutters. By default, the component doesnâ€™t ignore
of the gutters.

A value that indicates whether the parent container respects or ignores a documentâ€™s margins. Ignoring document margins positions the component at the edge of the display. This property affects the layout only if the component is in the first or last column.
Valid values:
(default). The parent container ignores the margins.
. The parent container ignores the left margin.
. The parent container ignores the right margin.
. The parent container ignores margins on both sides (if any).
Instead of specifying margins, you can set this property to
to indicate that the parent container ignores both margins, or set it to
to ignore none of the gutters. By default, the parent container doesnâ€™t ignore any of the document margins.
The margins for the top and bottom of the component, as a single integer that is applied to the top and bottom margins, or as an object containing separate properties for top and bottom.
The maximum width of the content within the component. Specify this value as a number in points, or use one of the available units of measure for components. See
This property is supported for
, and
components. All other components ignore this property.

with
as the specified
type.
The minimum height of the component. A component is taller than its defined
when the contents require it. Specify this value as a number in points, or use one of the available units of measure for components. See
The minimum width of the layout when you use it within a container with
as the specified
type.
The padding between the content of the component and the edges of the component.

A value that indicates whether the component respects or ignores the viewport padding. Ignoring viewport padding positions the component at the edge of the display screen. This property affects the layout only if the component is in the first or last column.
Valid values:
(default). The component doesnâ€™t ignore the padding.
. The component ignores the left padding.
. The component ignores the right padding.
. The component ignores the padding, if any, on both sides.
Instead of specifying padding, you can set this property to
to indicate the component ignores the padding on both sides, or set it to
to ignore neither padding. By default, it doesnâ€™t ignore either padding.

object to define an array of conditional component layout properties and the conditions under which to apply them. When a condition is met, the value of a property in

abstract.text: Specify the units of measure to use for margins, minimum heights, and other dimensions.
Get Apple News Format reference information, and create signature content for Apple News.
The object for defining the positioning for a specific component within the articleâ€™s column system.
The object for defining a condition that, when met, causes conditional properties to go into effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for an automatically placed component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining a button componentâ€™s conditional properties, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a component layout, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a component style, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a component text style, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a container component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a divider component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a document style, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a section component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a text component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
The object for defining conditional properties for a text style, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
Properties shared by all container types.
The component for defining a horizontal line to visually divide parts of your article.
The object for displaying components side by side in a Container component.
The component for displaying JPEG, WebP, PNG, or GIF images.
The component for including a logo image.
The object for defining the space above and below a component.
The object for defining space around the content in a table cell.
The units of measurement Apple News Format supports.
